item.title: FITE7410 AML and CFT
item.description: Introduction Money laundering definition covers all kinds of methods used to change the identity of illegally obtained money (i.e. crime proceeds) so that it appears to have originated from a legitimate source stages - frequently involving numerous transactions placement physical disposal of cash proceeds derived from illegal activities layering separating illicit proceeds from their source by creating complex layers of financial transactions integration returning the laundered proceeds back into the general financial system so that the proceeds appear to be the result of legitimate business activities Terrorist financing
